result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody J Meyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Cody J Meyer
parties.address: 5792 County Road I, Oconto Falls, WI 54154

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any prison term that the defendant may be serving.

miscConds.notes: Joint and several with co-defendant Amy Harris (14CF29)

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.

The defendant may not have any contact with the victim (PB).
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions as count #3 except for fine, DNA surcharge and sample.
Concurrent with: Count #3

miscConds.notes: The defendant must submit a DNA sample with surcharge assessed if one has not already been submitted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody J Meyer

defendant.name: Meyer, Cody J
defendant.address: 5792 County Road I, Oconto Falls, WI 54154

records.addlTxt: for Judgment for Restitution and Court Ordered Financial Obligations
and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing
For Restitution and for Court Ordered Financial Obligations

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Called at 11:29 AM. Cody Meyer appears in person and in custody with counsel Thomas Roley. State appears by Charles Simono. State - resolved - defendant would plead G to counts #3 and #4 as alleged, DRI counts #1 and #2; joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 3 years, #3 - court costs, #4 - fine of $750 plus costs and surcharges - #2 - restitution - joint and several with co-defendant Amy Harris - $786.37 plus VW surcharge (Roley objects to that restitition amount for stated reasons). Discussion regarding joint recommendation. Recess to talk to counsel (11:33 AM).  Back on record at 11:37 AM with same appearances. Roley - client is willing to accept the restituion amount as previously stated. Meyer agrees but has questions regarding it. Meyer will still accept agreement. State - addiitonal conditions are: AODA and follow thru, restitution - J&S of $786.37 plus $78.63 VW surcharge totalling $865.00, absolute sobriety, no possesioin of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, employment/school, no contact with victim or his person or property owned by victim, offers exhibit #1. Roley and Meyer agree. court receives exhibits #1 after no objections. Court DRI #1 and #2. Meyer pleads G to counts #3 and #4 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constititonal rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommenation. Roley makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Meyer makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #3 and #4 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years, concurrent to each other but consecutive to prison term he will be serving, with conditions of: #3 - court costs - paid thru probation, #4 - $750.00 fine plus costs and surcharges totalling $1931.75 - paid thru probation, restitution of $865.00 - joint and several with co-defendant Amy Harris (14CF29) - take bond posted and remainder due thru probation, $250.00 DNA surcharge on count #4 - paid thru probation, AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school with verbage, no contact with victim, submit DNA sample unleess one has already been submittted , no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 21, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial on May 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Called at 1:45 PM. Cody Meyer appears in person and with counsel Thomas Roley. State appears by JBC. Roley - no resolution - set for JT. Court goes thru Frye with the defendant - plea offer is no longer valid. Defendant understands Frye and the consequences of rejecting the plea offer. Court continues bond, set for JT on 5/22/14 at 8:30 AM. Court - subpoena analyst ASAP.

ADDRESS INFO for Cody J Meyer
Current: 5792 County Road I, Oconto Falls, WI 54154   (Effective: 03-12-2014)
Prior: 5792 County Highway I, Oconto Falls, WI 54154
Final pre-trial on April 30, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Called at 4:48 PM. Cody Meyer appears in person and in custody with attorney Thomas Roley. State appears by Charles Simono. State has filed Information that mirrors complaint in anticipation of a waiver of PH. Roley provides court with waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Roley has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and plead NG to all counts. Court continues bond, set for FPT on 4/30/14 at 1:15 PM.
Preliminary hearing on March 19, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Called at 10:59. Cody Meyer appears in person and in custody with attorney Thomas Roley. State appears by Charles Simono. Court reads charges and penalties. Roley waives further reading, requests PH. Court sets for PH on 3/19/14 at 3:00 PM. Roley - bond - asks for signature bond for stated reasons. State - bond - asks court to continue bond. Court continues bond.
